extendedInfo.description: Where should you eat tonight? The Eater App has the answer. This app serves up the beloved dining recommendations of Eater.com, the popular restaurant and nightlife site. Use the Eater App to: â¢ Find Eater 38 and Eater Heatmap restaurants and bars in your vicinity in many major U.S. cities. â¢ See a list of all Eater 38s and hotspots in those cities. â¢ Get phone numbers, addresses, and directions right when they're needed. â¢ Read the latest Eater stories from all the cities covered by Eater.Please note that the Eater App is currently designed for use in top U.S. dining cities only. Residents of regions lacking skyscrapers are likely to be disappointed by the Eater App. Eater is the source for people who care about dining and drinking in the nation's most important food cities. A favorite of industry pros and amateurs alike, Eater has an uncanny knack for finding out what's opening where, who's serving what, and how it's all going down. Visit Eater on the web at Eater.com, or follow on Twitter @Eater.Download the Eater app right this second. You'll never struggle to find the very best eating and drinking in America's top dining cities again.

reviews.title: Good for foodies, bad for Android
reviews.comment: I do like looking at the restaurant list and short write ups. I\'ve installed this on two android devices and it won\'t close properly on either, have to force close every time.
reviews.author: David Moskowitz

reviews.title: Needs work
reviews.comment: Somewhat useful, but serious usability bugs. List feature is really sketchy.
reviews.author: Mike Patrick

reviews.title: Does what it says it does
reviews.comment: Good app for finding the buzzed about restaurants in major cities, and for reading restaurant news.
reviews.author: Simon Connolly

reviews.title: Good app IF you live in a city they cover
reviews.comment: Eater currently has 23 city sites, if you live in or around one of those cities (or are planning on visiting one) then this app may be useful.  If you live in Bug Tussle don\'t be surprised when your local places don\'t pop up.
reviews.author: Chris Durkin

reviews.title: Very poorly designed app!
reviews.comment: No back-button functionality. Frustrating to use. Constantly closing the app by accident trying to get back to home screen.
reviews.author: Morgan Curtis

reviews.title: Extremely limited
reviews.comment: Absolutely zero restaurants listed in the entire Tucson area. A city with some of, if not THE best Mexican food restaurants in the country. Phoenix (the 12th largest metro area in the US) is also blank... I guess you need to live in New York for this to be of any use. Pretty weak, but at least it\'s free.
reviews.author: Charlie Belk

reviews.title: Improperly Marketed/Positioned
reviews.comment: The app itself is fine. It is an app for reading reviews and stories from Eater in the markets they cover. They are not a competitor to Yelp or anything like that and should not even try to be. Way too many ads, and useless splash screen.
reviews.author: David Abasta

reviews.title: Not remotely ready for release
reviews.comment: I\'m not even able to check out the available restaurants in their limited city list, I can\'t tell how in-depth or helpful this app actually is to the select few that can actually utilize it.
reviews.author: Roni Ata

reviews.title: Useless
reviews.comment: I love the concept,  but what\'s the point if there\'s nothing near me? Denver is not a small town guys....
reviews.author: Stephen Fronda

reviews.title: Slow and badly designed
reviews.comment: First load took nearly a minute. Map resolution is poor and grainy not designed for retina display. Stick with their website since it works better than the app.
reviews.author: Blake Bobit

reviews.title: Works well, needs some work
reviews.comment: The app seems to work well in the Atlanta market. The splash screen is a little useless and annoying; as are the very \"in your face\" ads. I get it that revenue needs to be generated... but the ads make me want to not use the app. A little more polish, this would be worth using.
reviews.author: Robert Sigler

reviews.title: Hoora!
reviews.comment: Excellent app despite some previous negative reviews. theyre working hard on improving it so I dont mind the simplicity as long as it gets the job done! :)
reviews.author: Teo Dela Santa

reviews.title: Not in all cities
reviews.comment: Charlie should have read the app description first before downloading, only works in the 23 cities they currently service. Since I live in South Florida, works great.
reviews.author: James Clements

reviews.title: Doesnt cover phoenix
reviews.comment: Very little coverage overall.  Yelp is much better
reviews.author: jack schulz

reviews.title: Meh, not quite there yet.
reviews.comment: Slow, not many listings, reviews are hard to read (large font in a small space), back button often exits the app, and why does every restaurant have a \"38\" on it -- is that a score?
reviews.author: Ben Zibble

reviews.title: Not Ready for Prime Time
reviews.comment: The rush to release resulted in a lack of usability.
reviews.author: Jack Carr

reviews.title: Nothing for TN?!?
reviews.comment: Not a single city for Tennessee?!? Nashville should at least be on the list.
reviews.author: Tracy Stram

reviews.title: Wish you could choose 0 stars!
reviews.comment: I really thought this would be awesome, as my husband and I travel a lot and love to try new places...especially local places. I couldn\'t get it to go anywhere other than where I am located, which may be fine for some, but I like to plan ahead, and when I tried to zoom out, my phone completely froze up, causing me to have to reboot it (can\'t remove the battery). On top of all of that, it shows no places to eat in Birmingham, Alabama? Seriously? Horrible app that I removed less than 5 minutes after installing.
reviews.author: Angel Wakefield

reviews.title: A bit clunky
reviews.comment: This app is exactly what I wished for, but when it arrived, it arrived a bit clunky.    I\'ve got a Galaxy S4, so for the next month or so, no app should be slow.  This one chunks around when I use the map and select restaurants. That said, I\'ve wanted an app that shows the Eater 38 and Eater Heatmap in SF, and that\'s what this is.   So bravo on the idea, but let\'s work on the execution.  Also, get rid of those terrible banner ads.  They slow everything down and make your app look bad.  The $0.02 you get per accidental click-through doesn\'t outweigh the user experience.  Let\'s have some respect, huh, Eater?
reviews.author: Patrick Hackett

reviews.title: Worthless
reviews.comment: No restaurants found in north central Phoenix.  Not accurate at all.
reviews.author: Daniel Sifferman
